normalised: **five G Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**

unnormalised: New Delhi – The nationwide 5G rollout continues apace, with major telecom operators Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio expanding their network coverage significantly. As of today, 17/10/2024, 5G services are available in over 400 cities, including key metros and tier-2 locations like Lucknow and Jaipur.
normalised: New Delhi – The nationwide five G rollout continues apace, with major telecom operators Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio expanding their network coverage significantly. As of today, seventeenth october two thousand and twenty four, five G services are available in over four hundred cities, including key metros and tier-two locations like Lucknow and Jaipur.

unnormalised: Jio announced its plans to complete pan-India coverage by December 2024, investing an estimated Rs. 2 lakh crore in infrastructure. Airtel is targeting significant coverage in all circles by March 2025. The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) is closely monitoring the rollout progress.
normalised: Jio announced its plans to complete pan-India coverage by December two thousand and twenty four, investing an estimated rupee two lakh crore in infrastructure. Airtel is targeting significant coverage in all circles by March two thousand and twenty five. The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (T R A I) is closely monitoring the rollout progress.

unnormalised: The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) held a review meeting at 11:00 hrs yesterday with all stakeholders to address potential roadblocks, including right-of-way issues and fiberization challenges. The government's PLI scheme is providing crucial impetus to domestic manufacturing of 5G equipment.
normalised: The Department of Telecommunications (D O T) held a review meeting at eleven o’clock yesterday with all stakeholders to address potential roadblocks, including right-of-way issues and fiberization challenges. The government's P L I scheme is providing crucial impetus to domestic manufacturing of five G equipment.

unnormalised: Early adopters are experiencing download speeds up to 10x faster than 4G, enabling enhanced streaming, online gaming, and IoT applications. Trials are underway for 5G-enabled drone deliveries in rural Maharashtra, showcasing the technology’s potential impact on last-mile connectivity. The 5G spectrum auction was completed on 26/07/2022.
normalised: Early adopters are experiencing download speeds up to ten times faster than four G, enabling enhanced streaming, online gaming, and I O T applications. Trials are underway for five G-enabled drone deliveries in rural Maharashtra, showcasing the technology’s potential impact on last-mile connectivity. The five G spectrum auction was completed on twenty sixth july two thousand and twenty two.
